law.text:
The applicant for certification as a geologist-in-training shall demonstrate the following as evidence that he or she is qualified:
Successful completion of a minimum of thirty (30) semester hours or forty-five (45) quarter hours of course work in geology culminating in a baccalaureate or advanced degree in geology, geophysics, geochemistry, or geological or geotechnical engineering from an accredited college or university. At the discretion of the board, courses dealing with applied geological science given under the auspices of an academic department other than geology may be considered toward fulfillment of this requirement.
A passing score on the board's examination in the fundamentals of geology. The board may allow students enrolled in the final year of an approved undergraduate program to take this examination. Upon passing the examination, the applicant may apply to the board to be enrolled and receive a certificate as a geologist-in-training.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 159, sec. 4, effective June 20, 2005.
